question: 老朽
partsOfSpeech: noun, する verb, の adjective
sourceMnemonic: <kanji>Elderly</kanji> people start to <kanji>decay</kanji> and they get all <vocabulary>decrepit</vocabulary> and gross. Like a corpse. Bleh. Good thing I'll never be <vocabulary>too old</vocabulary>. Ho ho ho!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
